oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Claim of Mosses Ray on State of Tennessee for supplies furnished to "Rebel Army"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: State reparation claim of Mosses Ray for "quartermaster stores." In the claim, Ray attests to the fact that he has "never voluntarily borne arms against the Government of the United States, for the purpose, or with; the intention, of aiding the late rebellion." Original in the Hardeman County Archives. The materials have been microfilmed and are available for research at the Tennessee State Library and Archives (Hardeman County Loose Records Project, Roll A-19,438).
